fields.description:
*Assessment*

While testing EUCA-11245, it was noticed that instances associated with the autoscaling group for certain ELBs weren't launched in the requested availability zones.  In short, ELB autoscaling groups reported being created successfully, however the instances associated with the autoscaling group failed to be created.  For example:
{code}
### ELB created by user ###
[root@c-02 ~]# eulb-describe-lbs ELB-Zone13 --region devops-admin@region-1 --show-long
LOAD_BALANCER	ELB-Zone13	ELB-Zone13-000693176866.lb.c-02.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com			{interval=30,target=TCP:80,timeout=5,healthy-threshold=3,unhealthy-threshold=3}	one,three				{protocol=HTTP,lb-port=80,instance-protocol=HTTP,instance-port=80}					{owner-alias=000770154596,group-name=euca-internal-000693176866-ELB-Zone13}		2015-09-20T15:05:19.015Z	internet-facing

### Autoscaling group listed by (eucalyptus)loadbalancing admin user - no instances listed  ###
[root@c-02 ~]# euscale-describe-auto-scaling-groups euca-internal-elb-000693176866-ELB-Zone13-three --region elb-admin@region-1 --show-long
AUTO-SCALING-GROUP	euca-internal-elb-000693176866-ELB-Zone13-three	lc-euca-internal-elb-000693176866-ELB-Zone13-three-09e17d8d	three	2015-09-20T15:05:19.934Z		EC2	1	1	1	300	0			arn:aws:autoscaling::000770154596:autoScalingGroup:53829d81-3141-43a7-addf-d4754ed05a96:autoScalingGroupName/euca-internal-elb-000693176866-ELB-Zone13-three	Default
TAG	auto-scaling-group	euca-internal-elb-000693176866-ELB-Zone13-three	service-type	loadbalancing	true
[root@c-02 ~]# euscale-describe-auto-scaling-groups euca-internal-elb-000693176866-ELB-Zone13-one --region elb-admin@region-1 --show-long
AUTO-SCALING-GROUP	euca-internal-elb-000693176866-ELB-Zone13-one	lc-euca-internal-elb-000693176866-ELB-Zone13-one-a24558f4	one	2015-09-20T15:05:19.825Z		EC2	1	1	1	300	0			arn:aws:autoscaling::000770154596:autoScalingGroup:7d3192da-7e93-4751-94eb-6b602e6b5eea:autoScalingGroupName/euca-internal-elb-000693176866-ELB-Zone13-one	Default
TAG	auto-scaling-group	euca-internal-elb-000693176866-ELB-Zone13-one	service-type	loadbalancing	true

### All instances under (eucalyptus) loadbalancing account associated with autoscaling group ###
[root@c-02 ~]# euca-describe-instances --filter tag-key="aws:autoscaling:groupName" --filter tag-value="euca-internal-elb-000693176866-ELB-Zone13*" --region elb-admin@region-1
[root@c-02 ~]#

### All instances under (eucalyptus) loadbalancing account ###
[root@c-02 ~]# euca-describe-instances --region elb-admin@region-1
RESERVATION	r-0b0dd765	000770154596	euca-internal-000693176866-ELB-Zone2
INSTANCE	i-40f5d197	emi-006650b0	euca-10-111-75-235.eucalyptus.c-02.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com	euca-10-111-76-20.eucalyptus.internal	running		0		m1.small	2015-09-20T15:04:23.786Z	two				monitoring-enabled	10.111.75.235	10.111.76.20			instance-store					hvm		66546ce5-02d7-4a24-a7da-444ea3de4157_two_1	sg-f1bcd0fc			arn:aws:iam::000770154596:instance-profile/internal/loadbalancer/loadbalancer-vm-000693176866-ELB-Zone2	x86_64
TAG	instance	i-40f5d197	aws:autoscaling:groupName	euca-internal-elb-000693176866-ELB-Zone2-two
TAG	instance	i-40f5d197	service-type	loadbalancing
RESERVATION	r-ada31957	000770154596	euca-internal-000693176866-ELB-Zone12
INSTANCE	i-a42bb12d	emi-006650b0	euca-10-111-76-5.eucalyptus.c-02.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com	euca-10-111-76-18.eucalyptus.internal	running		0		m1.small	2015-09-20T15:05:03.825Z	one				monitoring-enabled	10.111.76.5	10.111.76.18			instance-store					hvm		068c09f4-59e2-4611-af35-ffa6d2deab8c_one_1	sg-439eb2d1			arn:aws:iam::000770154596:instance-profile/internal/loadbalancer/loadbalancer-vm-000693176866-ELB-Zone12	x86_64
TAG	instance	i-a42bb12d	aws:autoscaling:groupName	euca-internal-elb-000693176866-ELB-Zone12-one
TAG	instance	i-a42bb12d	service-type	loadbalancing
RESERVATION	r-cc0f376b	000770154596	euca-internal-000693176866-ELB-Zone3
INSTANCE	i-e49b4d21	emi-006650b0	euca-10-111-76-4.eucalyptus.c-02.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com	euca-10-111-76-23.eucalyptus.internal	running		0		m1.small	2015-09-20T15:04:43.767Z	three				monitoring-enabled	10.111.76.4	10.111.76.23			instance-store					hvm		4b76b997-bdf8-412f-9bd0-8273051b2d61_three_1	sg-9fcb23b5			arn:aws:iam::000770154596:instance-profile/internal/loadbalancer/loadbalancer-vm-000693176866-ELB-Zone3	x86_64
TAG	instance	i-e49b4d21	aws:autoscaling:groupName	euca-internal-elb-000693176866-ELB-Zone3-three
TAG	instance	i-e49b4d21	service-type	loadbalancing
RESERVATION	r-e52ec2b8	000770154596	euca-internal-000693176866-ELB-Zone1
INSTANCE	i-d98bcf52	emi-006650b0	euca-10-111-76-3.eucalyptus.c-02.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com	euca-10-111-76-25.eucalyptus.internal	running		0		m1.small	2015-09-20T15:04:13.886Z	one				monitoring-enabled	10.111.76.3	10.111.76.25			instance-store					hvm		c8820f07-8e4e-4252-a4d3-52ced82e36af_one_1	sg-4fcabfac			arn:aws:iam::000770154596:instance-profile/internal/loadbalancer/loadbalancer-vm-000693176866-ELB-Zone1	x86_64
TAG	instance	i-d98bcf52	aws:autoscaling:groupName	euca-internal-elb-000693176866-ELB-Zone1-one
TAG	instance	i-d98bcf52	service-type	loadbalancing
RESERVATION	r-9e014c94	000770154596	euca-internal-000693176866-ELB-Zone12
INSTANCE	i-0c506d28	emi-006650b0	euca-10-111-76-0.eucalyptus.c-02.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com	euca-10-111-76-24.eucalyptus.internal	running		0		m1.small	2015-09-20T15:05:03.783Z	two				monitoring-enabled	10.111.76.0	10.111.76.24			instance-store					hvm		e193eee7-f42a-417b-b165-b659c71b9f78_two_1	sg-439eb2d1			arn:aws:iam::000770154596:instance-profile/internal/loadbalancer/loadbalancer-vm-000693176866-ELB-Zone12	x86_64
TAG	instance	i-0c506d28	aws:autoscaling:groupName	euca-internal-elb-000693176866-ELB-Zone12-two
TAG	instance	i-0c506d28	service-type	loadbalancing
{code}

fields.summary: ELB fails to create instance per availability zone

comments.body:
To verify that this wasn't associated with one account, I created another account - {{engineering}}, then created an ELB using the {{admin}} user credentials of that account.  Even though ELB shows as being created, instances associated with the autoscaling group are not:
{code}
[root@c-02 ~]# eulb-create-lb -z one,two,three -l "lb-port=80, protocol=HTTP, instance-port=80, instance-protocol=HTTP" Eng-ELB --region devops-admin@region-1
DNS_NAME	Eng-ELB-000693176866.lb.c-02.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com

[root@c-02 ~]# euscale-describe-auto-scaling-groups euca-internal-elb-000693176866-Eng-ELB-one --region elb-admin@region-1
AUTO-SCALING-GROUP	euca-internal-elb-000693176866-Eng-ELB-one	lc-euca-internal-elb-000693176866-Eng-ELB-one-00cb884f	one		1	1	1	Default
TAG	auto-scaling-group	euca-internal-elb-000693176866-Eng-ELB-one	service-type	loadbalancing	true
[root@c-02 ~]# euscale-describe-auto-scaling-groups euca-internal-elb-000693176866-Eng-ELB-two --region elb-admin@region-1
AUTO-SCALING-GROUP	euca-internal-elb-000693176866-Eng-ELB-two	lc-euca-internal-elb-000693176866-Eng-ELB-two-8cac863b	two		1	1	1	Default
TAG	auto-scaling-group	euca-internal-elb-000693176866-Eng-ELB-two	service-type	loadbalancing	true
[root@c-02 ~]# euscale-describe-auto-scaling-groups euca-internal-elb-000693176866-Eng-ELB-three --region elb-admin@region-1
AUTO-SCALING-GROUP	euca-internal-elb-000693176866-Eng-ELB-three	lc-euca-internal-elb-000693176866-Eng-ELB-three-b185f202	three		1	1	1	Default
TAG	auto-scaling-group	euca-internal-elb-000693176866-Eng-ELB-three	service-type	loadbalancing	true

[root@c-02 ~]# eulb-describe-lbs --region eng-admin@region-1 --show-long
[root@c-02 ~]#
{code}
[~hspencer] Do you have the system manifesting this?

[~spark], its [hspencer-1321 deployment|http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Master/1321/artifact/config_data/*view*/].  System is still up.  Found another issue that I will be reporting shortly.

Not sure what went wrong. Just checked with the system and it seems to be running fine: elbs are created and ASG instances are launched correctly.
There might be some temporary failure in EC2 that keeps ASGs from running instances. I see the logs that keeps failing to run instances for the affected ASGs, but given the INFO level logging, I can't check what the underlying reason were.

In the current architecture, ELB relies on ASGs to manage the ELB instances, and it does not have a way to show if the ASGs are not launching instances.
[~hspencer], we're suspecting the system may be resource constrained. Could you check if there is enough capacity in the cloud? (euca-describe-instance-types and euca-describe-addresses verbose)

[~dmitrii],

Yep, they are constrained.  There is a total of 8 public IPs on the system.  Currently the ELB is created with no message/error that states its not available.  The only reason I found out that they failed was after I tried to resolve the DNS name of the ELB.  To see the status of the instances, I had to use either the 'eucalyptus/admin' user credentials or the '(eucalyptus)loadbalancing/admin' user credentials. Shouldn't the ELB fail to be created if it can't create enough resources to satisfy the {{\--desired-capacity}} or {{-m/\--min-size}} of the AutoScaling group?  I would think from a robustness and user experience point of view, this would be the case, however I could be wrong here.  Maybe we could leverage an [error from AWS Auto Scaling error codes|http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AutoScaling/latest/APIReference/CommonErrors.html], [error from AWS ELB error codes|http://docs.aws.amazon.com/ElasticLoadBalancing/latest/APIReference/CommonErrors.html] or come up with one that is unique to Eucalyptus to inform the user that the ELB failed to be created.

The major hurdle is that ELB has no API that can tell the status of it's operation. We may be able to fail up front (EUCA-11078 for example), but it doesn't guarantee the successful operation of ELBs. Perhaps tagging might be useful.

[~hspencer] During the arch meeting, we discussed this problem and determined that we can't fix it in 4.2.0, because there is no proper interface for EC2 expose the availability of private IPs. Giving the operational state of ELB to users is the right approach, but it requires some architectural changes and discussion, primarily because AWS has no API to do it. EUCA-11424 is created to track the work.

Because we can't fix the underlying issue (admission control based on resource availability), the fix here is to display proper error when no servo VM is launched for an ELB. The error is displayed when users call DescribeInstanceHealth.

Fixed.

Eucalyptus Version: {{4.2.1-0.0.24116.75.20151124git2cab29b.el6}}

*Steps*

# Set up 2 Eucalyptus Clouds with Eucalyptus DNS enabled
#* [hspencer-120|http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Maint-4.2/120/]
#* [hspencer-122|http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Maint-4.2/122/]
# Used the following file to federate the clouds:
{code}
# cat federated-region.json
{
    "Regions": [
        {
            "CertificateFingerprint": "96:F4:AA:2A:09:D2:14:D1:E0:4A:4E:6D:84:C9:8F:88:96:FC:A3:E5:D6:07:6A:E9:EE:5E:67:CF:2E:9C:03:7D",
            "CertificateFingerprintDigest": "SHA-256",
            "IdentifierPartitions": [
                1
            ],
            "Name": "rick-ross",
            "Services": [
                {
                    "Endpoints": [
                        "http://identity.g-22-07.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/"
                    ],
                    "Type": "identity"
                },
                {
                    "Endpoints": [
                        "http://ec2.g-22-07.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/"
                    ],
                    "Type": "compute"
                }
            ]
        },
        {
            "CertificateFingerprint": "20:D0:32:09:E2:7D:42:A4:AB:39:DC:C5:8C:41:6E:AB:2E:1A:F1:6F:ED:03:8D:BD:74:69:4D:C8:1E:F6:E3:D6",
            "CertificateFingerprintDigest": "SHA-256",
            "IdentifierPartitions": [
                2
            ],
            "Name": "the-weeknd",
            "Services": [
                {
                    "Endpoints": [
                        "http://identity.c-09.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/"
                    ],
                    "Type": "identity"
                },
                {
                    "Endpoints": [
                        "http://ec2.c-09.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/"
                    ],
                    "Type": "compute"
                }
            ]
        }
    ]
}

# euca-describe-regions --region euca-admin@rick-ross
REGION	rick-ross	http://ec2.g-22-07.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
REGION	the-weeknd	http://ec2.c-09.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/

# euca-describe-regions --region euca-admin@the-weeknd
REGION	rick-ross	http://ec2.g-22-07.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
REGION	the-weeknd	http://ec2.c-09.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
{code}
# Created 'development-operations' and 'engineering' accounts under 'rick-ross' region:
{code}
[root@a-18 ~]# euare-accountlist --region euca-admin@rick-ross
(eucalyptus)database	000297623636
(eucalyptus)objectstorage	000931571013
engineering	001673742098
(eucalyptus)cloudformation	000638094215
eucalyptus	000567300725
(eucalyptus)imaging	000643003024
(eucalyptus)aws-exec-read	000181008720
(eucalyptus)blockstorage	000538082825
(eucalyptus)loadbalancing	000161670087
development-operations	001858167650
{code}
# Added Wily Ubuntu EMI to 'the-weeknd' region
{code}
[root@a-18 ~]# euca-describe-images --all --region devops-admin@the-weeknd
IMAGE	emi-351618a2	ubuntu-wily-x86_64-hvm-20151127/wily-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.raw.manifest.xml	000841653194	available	public	x86_64	machine				instance-store	hvm
{code}
# Created an ELB on 'rick-ross' region using both AZs:
{code}
[root@a-18 ~]# eulb-describe-lbs --region devops-admin@rick-ross --show-longLOAD_BALANCER	NginxELBRickRoss	NginxELBRickRoss-001858167650.lb.g-22-07.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com			{interval=30,target=TCP:80,timeout=5,healthy-threshold=3,unhealthy-threshold=3}	hood-billionaire,black-dollar	subnet-952cd14f,subnet-2b57c761	vpc-08b39780		{protocol=HTTP,lb-port=80,instance-protocol=HTTP,instance-port=80}					{owner-alias=001858167650,group-name=default}	{sg-4b62614c}	2015-12-01T13:49:03.447Z	internet-facing

## checked AS groups under '(eucalyptus)loadbalancing' account ##
[root@a-18 ~]# euscale-describe-auto-scaling-groups --show-long --region elb-admin@rick-ross
AUTO-SCALING-GROUP	euca-internal-elb-001858167650-NginxELBRickRoss-hood-billionaire	lc-euca-internal-elb-001858167650-NginxELBRickRoss-hood-billionaire-477a2bca	hood-billionaire	2015-12-01T13:49:06.142Z		EC2	1	1	1	300	0	subnet-952cd14f		arn:aws:autoscaling::000161670087:autoScalingGroup:b57721de-ab9f-4f32-81bc-44f58a6a09f0:autoScalingGroupName/euca-internal-elb-001858167650-NginxELBRickRoss-hood-billionaire	Default
INSTANCE	i-e4e90377	hood-billionaire	InService	Healthy	lc-euca-internal-elb-001858167650-NginxELBRickRoss-hood-billionaire-477a2bca
TAG	auto-scaling-group	euca-internal-elb-001858167650-NginxELBRickRoss-hood-billionaire	service-type	loadbalancing	true
AUTO-SCALING-GROUP	euca-internal-elb-001858167650-NginxELBRickRoss-black-dollar	lc-euca-internal-elb-001858167650-NginxELBRickRoss-black-dollar-b8d2508f	black-dollar	2015-12-01T13:49:06.847Z		EC2	1	1	1	300	0	subnet-2b57c761		arn:aws:autoscaling::000161670087:autoScalingGroup:61617018-afcb-473d-b3cc-722a4fd6ae38:autoScalingGroupName/euca-internal-elb-001858167650-NginxELBRickRoss-black-dollar	Default
INSTANCE	i-2a37f831	black-dollar	InService	Healthy	lc-euca-internal-elb-001858167650-NginxELBRickRoss-black-dollar-b8d2508f
TAG	auto-scaling-group	euca-internal-elb-001858167650-NginxELBRickRoss-black-dollar	service-type	loadbalancing	true
{code}
#  Launched instances on one of the AZs on 'the-weeknd' region to soak up all VM type capacity
